subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... Attributes and tag interfaces are, essentially, isomorphic, when applied to classes. The neat thing about attributes is that they also apply to methods
messageBody:
Ilja Preuss wrote:

> Andrew Forward wrote:
> >> Ilja wrote:
> >> What's a test category?
> >
> > I believe some of the features stem from NUnit 2.2.
> > Categories is an excellent idea that I use quite a bit. In
> > essence, you are group tests (fixtures etc) into groups and just run
> > those groups.
>
> IIRC, this can be done using Junit, for example by tagging TestCases
> with Interfaces and using a specialized TestRunner. I'd guess the same
> could be done with annotations without touching the Junit core library
> at all.

Attributes and tag interfaces are, essentially, isomorphic, when applied
to classes. The neat thing about attributes is that they also apply to
methods and, I imagine, fields and properties. There's gold in them thar
hills.
